conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graphs to determine the maximum distance between the truck and the bus.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of each vehicle over time.
The area under each curve represents the distance traveled by each vehicle during the braking process.
Calculate the distance traveled by each vehicle by finding the area under the respective v-t graph.
Initial velocity of the truck is 40 m/s, final velocity is 0 m/s, and time is 20 s.
Distance traveled by the truck is 400 m.
Initial velocity of the bus is 30 m/s, final velocity is 0 m/s, and time is 30 s.
Distance traveled by the bus is 450 m.
Initially, the vehicles are 30 meters apart.
The relative velocity between the truck and the bus is the difference in their velocities.
From the graph, the truck decelerates faster than the bus.
The maximum distance occurs when the velocities of the truck and the bus are equal, at t = 10 s.
Distance traveled by the truck in 10 s is 200 m.
Distance traveled by the bus in 10 s is 150 m.
Calculate the maximum distance between the vehicles using initial separation and distances traveled.
The maximum distance between them is 80 meters.
